channel.title: Hackathons on StackRef Whistle
channel.description: Recent content in Hackathons on StackRef Whistle

item.title: Presenting 'Security Testing During Ideation: A Hackathon Perspective' at DevSecCon24!
item.description: I’ll be presenting at this year’s Snyk DevSecCon24 on June 27, 2023, in a lighting talk titled “Security Testing During Ideation: A Hackathon Perspective!”

item.title: Infracost and our own Cossell added to automated hackathon scoring
item.description: Exciting news is coming out of StackRef HQ as we announce the addition of two new automated judging tools for hackathons: Infracost and Cossell!

item.title: Big Ideas
item.description:
“Every once in a while, a new technology, an old problem, and a big idea turn into an innovation.” — Dean Kamen

While the Segway didn’t change the world how Mr. Kamen had visualized it would, it was indeed a big idea.

This quote from Dean Kamen, the inventor of the Segway, beautifully captures the essence of innovation. In today’s fast-paced world, businesses and organizations are constantly seeking ways to foster innovation, and one proven method is through the use of internal hackathons.

item.title: Internal Hackathons and Innovation
item.description: Internal hackathons, also known as innovation sprints, have become increasingly popular in companies around the world. These events are designed to encourage employees to come up with creative solutions to business challenges, and to foster a culture of innovation within the organization. In this blog post, we will explore how internal hackathons can improve company innovation.
